trans-unit.source: Displays a shortcut menu at the specified location

seg-source.mrk: Displays a shortcut menu at the specified location

target.mrk: Displays a shortcut menu at the specified location

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed

target.mrk: Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu

target.mrk: Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

target.mrk: Specifies the horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

trans-unit.source: If this is -1, the current mouse position is used.

seg-source.mrk: If this is -1, the current mouse position is used.

target.mrk: If this is -1, the current mouse position is used.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

target.mrk: Specifies the vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

trans-unit.source: If this is -1, the current mouse position is used.

seg-source.mrk: If this is -1, the current mouse position is used.

target.mrk: If this is -1, the current mouse position is used.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies how to position the menu horizontally:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies how to position the menu horizontally:

target.mrk: Specifies how to position the menu horizontally:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Center the menu horizontally relative to $iX

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Center the menu horizontally relative to $iX

target.mrk: 0 - Center the menu horizontally relative to $iX

trans-unit.source: 1 - Position the menu so that its left side is aligned with $iX

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Position the menu so that its left side is aligned with $iX

target.mrk: 1 - Position the menu so that its left side is aligned with $iX

trans-unit.source: 2 - Position the menu so that its right side is aligned with $iX

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Position the menu so that its right side is aligned with $iX

target.mrk: 2 - Position the menu so that its right side is aligned with $iX

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies how to position the menu vertically:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies how to position the menu vertically:

target.mrk: Specifies how to position the menu vertically:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Position the menu so that its bottom side is aligned with $iY

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Position the menu so that its bottom side is aligned with $iY

target.mrk: 0 - Position the menu so that its bottom side is aligned with $iY

trans-unit.source: 1 - Position the menu so that its top side is aligned with $iY

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Position the menu so that its top side is aligned with $iY

target.mrk: 1 - Position the menu so that its top side is aligned with $iY

trans-unit.source: 2 - Center the menu vertically relative to $iY

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Center the menu vertically relative to $iY

target.mrk: 2 - Center the menu vertically relative to $iY

trans-unit.source: [optional] Use to determine the selection withouta parent window:

seg-source.mrk: Use to determine the selection withouta parent window:

target.mrk: Use to determine the selection withouta parent window:

trans-unit.source: 1 - Do not send notification messages
2 - Return the menu item identifier of the user's selection

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Return the menu item identifier of the user's selection

target.mrk: 2 - Return the menu item identifier of the user's selection

trans-unit.source: [optional] Mouse button the shortcut menu tracks:

seg-source.mrk: Mouse button the shortcut menu tracks:

target.mrk: Mouse button the shortcut menu tracks:

trans-unit.source: 0 - The user can select items with only the left mouse button

seg-source.mrk: 0 - The user can select items with only the left mouse button

target.mrk: 0 - The user can select items with only the left mouse button

trans-unit.source: 1 - The user can select items with both left and right buttons

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The user can select items with both left and right buttons

target.mrk: 1 - The user can select items with both left and right buttons

trans-unit.source: Return Value

If $iNotify is set to 2, the return value is the menu item identifier of the item that the user selected. If the user cancels the menu without making a selection or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero. If $iNotify is not set to 2, the return value is 1.

seg-source.mrk: If $iNotify is set to 2, the return value is the menu item identifier of the item that the user selected.
If the user cancels the menu without making a selection or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero.
If $iNotify is not set to 2, the return value is 1.

target.mrk: If $iNotify is set to 2, the return value is the menu item identifier of the item that the user selected.
If the user cancels the menu without making a selection or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero.
If $iNotify is not set to 2, the return value is 1.

Search TrackPopupMenu in MSDN Library.
